item.title: 巴西 COP30 峰会气候谈判进入关键时刻
item.description: 在巴西领导联合国气候谈判的谈判代表们为解决全球在遏制温室气体排放方面令人失望的进展提出了各种方案，尽管各国在金融和贸易政策方面仍存在很大分歧。【原文：Negotiators leading United Nations climate talks in Brazil laid out options for addressing the world’s disappointing progress in curbing greenhouse gas emissions, though countries remain far apart on finance and trade policy.】

item.title: 钢铁很难做到 "绿色"。一些公司仍在尝试
item.description: 钢铁是世界上最重要的商品之一，但生产钢铁是造成地球变暖的二氧化碳排放的主要来源。唯一现实的替代品是使用可再生能源和更节能的生产技术的 "绿色钢铁"。【原文：Steel is one of the world’s most vital commodities, but producing it is a major source of planet-warming carbon dioxide emissions. The only realistic alternative is “green steel” that uses renewable power and more energy-efficient production techniques.】

item.title: 阿尔-戈尔告诉 COP30，美国可能已达到 "特朗普峰值
item.description: 有人说，阿尔-戈尔一到，缔约方大会的时钟就开始滴答作响。随着这位美国前副总统周一抵达贝伦，达成协议已进入倒计时。【原文：Some say the COP clock officially starts ticking once Al Gore arrives. And with the former US vice president in Belém on Monday, well, the countdown to a deal is on.】

item.title: 阿尔-戈尔说 "我们可能已经度过了特朗普的巅峰期
item.description:
前美国副总统阿尔-戈尔做客阿克沙特-拉蒂的 "零点 "节目，谈论无赖的美国、中国的野心以及如何消除气候变化的两极分化。【原文：

Former US Vice-President Al Gore joins Akshat Rathi on Zero to talk about a rogue US, China’s ambitions, and how to depolarize climate change.

】

item.title: 印度表示，富裕国家必须实现气候净零排放并付出代价
item.description: 印度环境部长布彭德-亚达夫（Bhupender Yadav）在巴西举行的 COP30 峰会上表示，富裕国家必须加快实现零排放的步伐，并采取更多措施筹集资金，帮助发展中经济体实现气候目标。【原文：Richer nations must move faster on zeroing out emissions and do more to mobilize funding to help developing economies meet climate targets, India’s Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav told the COP30 summit in Brazil.】

item.title: 华盛顿邮报》称，特朗普的联邦紧急事务管理局局长在 6 个月后辞职
item.description: 据《华盛顿邮报》报道，特朗普政府在联邦紧急事务管理局的最高官员在任职约六个月后即将离任。【原文：The Trump administration’s top official at the Federal Emergency Management Agency is departing his post after about six months on the job, according to the Washington Post.】

item.title: 英国被丹麦取代，成为世界上在气候问题上最具雄心的国家
item.description: 在未来十年应对气候变化的斗争中，英国不再是世界上削减二氧化碳排放量最雄心勃勃的国家。【原文：The UK is no longer the most ambitious nation in the world when it comes to cutting CO2 emissions in the fight against climate change over the next decade.】

item.title: 世界偏离了减少甲烷热量排放的承诺
item.description: 根据联合国的一份评估报告，世界仍然远远落后于全球减少甲烷排放的承诺，该报告强调，需要迅速开展积极的工作，抑制这种超级污染物的排放。【原文：The world remains far behind global commitments to slash methane, according to a United Nations assessment that underscores the need for rapid, aggressive work to stifle emissions of the super pollutant.】

item.title: 德意志银行加入巴克莱和阿波罗的行列，瞄准能源转型交易
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）增加了其与环境、社会和公司治理相关的融资目标，以高碳行业的交易为目标。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG increased its ESG-related financing goals to target deals in high-carbon sectors.】

item.title: DeepMind 最新人工智能天气模型瞄准能源交易商
item.description: 谷歌 DeepMind 发布了一个新的人工智能天气模型，并称该模型比之前建立的任何模型都更快、更准确，同时还为能源交易商提供了更多工具。【原文：Google DeepMind has released a new artificial intelligence weather model that it says is faster and more accurate than anything it’s built before, while providing additional tools for energy traders.】

item.title: 巴西将在 COP30 上启动工业减排计划
item.description: 巴西即将启动一项削减工业排放的计划，这是其实现到 2050 年净零排放目标的关键一步。【原文：Brazil is set to kick off a plan to cut industrial emissions, a key step toward its goal of reaching net-zero emissions by 2050.】

item.title: 韩国关闭本国工厂，旨在推动全球煤炭出口
item.description: 韩国总统李在明（Lee Jae Myung）提出了到 2040 年关闭本国发电厂的目标。【原文：South Korea aims to support a wider global shift away from coal-fired power as it pursues President Lee Jae Myung’s goal to shutter the country’s own plants by 2040.】

item.title: 拯救世界上最重要的碳汇之一是笔大生意
item.description: 欢迎来到 COP30 的第二周。随着各国环保部长的陆续到场，达成协议的压力也随之增大。今天的时事通讯将为您介绍代表们关注的三个关键问题：摆脱化石燃料的斗争、特朗普的贸易战和清理关键矿产。【原文：Welcome to week two of COP30. This is when things start getting real as environmental ministers show up and the pressure ramps up for an agreement. There are a lot of outcomes in play, and today’s newsletter catches you up on three key issues on delegates’ minds: the fight to transition away from fossil fuels, Trump’s trade war and cleaning up critical minerals.】

item.title: 巴克莱称赞巴西森林基金取得成功，即使基金规模仅为 50 亿美元
item.description: Barclays Plc 集团可持续发展和转型融资主管表示，尽管巴西为新森林保护基金吸引的资金仅占其原定融资目标的 20%左右，但这一举措仍应被视为成功。【原文：Even though Brazil has only managed to attract roughly 20% of its original financing target for a new forest conservation fund, the initiative should be considered a success, according to Barclays Plc’s group head of sustainable and transition finance.】

item.title: 化石燃料转型成为巴西气候斗争的关键所在
item.description: 周六，数千名抗议者在巴西城市贝伦（Belém）阻断了交通，他们恳求各国领导人加快行动，应对全球变暖问题。随着联合国气候谈判进入关键的第二周，未来几天将决定这一呼吁是否得到响应。【原文：The thousands of protesters who brought traffic to a halt Saturday in the Brazilian city of Belém implored leaders to act faster to tackle global warming. As United Nations climate talks enter their critical second week, the next few days will determine whether that call is heeded.】

item.title: 水资源危机迫使伊朗实行配给制，伊朗开始云层播种
item.description: 伊朗几十年来最严重的旱灾迫使当局配给供应，并警告说可能会从首都撤离，在此之后，伊朗已开始播种云层，以增加降雨量。【原文：Iran has started cloud-seeding to boost rainfall after the country’s worst drought in decades forced authorities to ration supply and warn of possible evacuations from the capital.】

item.title: 贝莱德的 GIP 和 Pentagreen 聘请亚洲基础设施债务公司
item.description: 在新加坡推动整个地区（尤其是东南亚）减少碳排放的同时，私人融资公司也在扩大其基础设施债务团队。【原文：Private financing firms are expanding their infrastructure debt teams as Singapore pushes to reduce carbon emissions across the region, notably Southeast Asia.】

item.title: 南加州降雨量创纪录后洛杉矶降雨减弱
item.description: 在创纪录的降雨引发洪水和泥石流风险之后，洛杉矶和南加州各地的降雨将逐渐减弱，尤其是在最近被野火烧焦的地区。【原文：Showers will be winding down across Los Angeles and Southern California after record rains brought raised the risks of floods and mudslides, especially in areas scorched by recent wildfires.】

item.title: 巴西正在向亚马逊河注入资金。这些公司也想分一杯羹
item.description:
初创企业正踊跃参与巴西拯救亚马逊雨林的货币化进程。【原文：

Startups are rushing in to monetize Brazil’s push to save the Amazon rainforest.

】

item.title: 中国气候顾问警告贸易壁垒阻碍实现减排目标
item.description: 代表中国参加 COP30 峰会的团队成员表示，贸易规则和限制，包括美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税和欧盟采取的措施，正在破坏全球限制气候变暖的努力，削弱气候雄心。【原文：Members of the team representing China at the COP30 summit said trade rules and restrictions, including US President Donald Trump’s tariffs and measures adopted by the EU, are undermining global efforts to limit warming and are weakening climate ambition.】

item.title: 洛杉矶降雨可能引发泥石流，烧毁地区可能被洪水淹没
item.description: 一场异常强烈的暴风雨给洛杉矶和大南加州地区带来了持续中度到高度的山洪暴发、泥石流和危险大风的风险，一直持续到周六晚间，给遭受火灾的居民区带来了严重的影响。【原文：An unusually strong storm drenching Los Angeles and the greater Southern California area brought continued moderate to high risk of flash flooding, mudslides and dangerous winds to fire-scarred neighborhoods through Saturday night.】

item.title: 大型抗议活动缺席多年后重返缔约方大会
item.description: 联合国气候峰会多年来一直在独裁国家举行，如今，抗议者再次走上民主巴西的街头（和水边）。预计将有数千人参加的游行将在贝伦拉开帷幕。【原文：After years of UN climate summits being held in authoritarian countries, protesters are once again taking to the streets (and water) in democratic Brazil. Today’s newsletter shows you what that looks like on the ground, as a march expected to draw thousands kicks off in Belém.】

item.title: 气候谈判转向开采关键矿产的风险
item.description: 各国越来越倾向于敲响警钟，警惕开采和加工关键矿物的危险，因为它们试图强调，在摆脱化石燃料的过渡过程中，不应以采用肮脏材料取而代之。【原文：Nations are edging closer to sounding the alarm about the perils of extracting and processing critical minerals, as they seek to emphasize the transition away from fossil fuels shouldn’t be replaced by an adoption of dirty materials instead.】

item.title: 气候抗议活动重返 COP30，在民主巴西举行
item.description:
联合国气候峰会多年来一直在独裁国家举行，活动家们再次举办活动，敦促各国加大力度、加快步伐。【原文：

After years of UN climate summits in authoritarian countries, activists are again staging events to urge countries to do more and move faster. 

】

item.title: 大雨来临前，洛杉矶、马里布泥石流威胁上升
item.description: 洛杉矶地区受火灾影响的居民区正在准备应对预计周五深夜将到来的破纪录降雨可能造成的泥石流威胁。【原文：Fire-stricken neighborhoods in the Los Angeles area are preparing for the threat of mudslides from potentially record-breaking rains expected to arrive late Friday night.】

item.title: 南非的全球环境影响力因政治争斗而削弱
item.description: 南非通常在全球气候和环境论坛上大放厥词，但由于一场导致其环境部长被解雇的政治斗争，南非的影响力受到削弱。【原文：South Africa, a normally vocal presence in global climate and environment forums, has eroded its influence because of a political fight that led to the firing of its environment minister.】

item.title: 联合国称 COP30 需要安全升级和更好的空调系统
item.description: COP30 第一周的闭幕充满戏剧性。联合国正在向巴西抱怨安保松懈和半成品设施让代表们在酷热中汗流浃背。抗议者将于周五动员起来。澳大利亚和土耳其正在争夺下一届缔约方大会的主办权。【原文：The first week of COP30 is wrapping up on a dramatic note. The United Nations is complaining to Brazil about lax security and half-built facilities that have left delegates sweating in oppressive heat. Protesters are set to mobilize on Friday. And Australia and Turkey are fighting over who gets to host the next COP.】

item.title: 欧洲追踪甲烷排放的首次尝试未能成功
item.description: 由于一些德国公司没有提交数据，欧盟首次甲烷排放清单（甲烷是导致全球变暖的最主要因素之一）一开始就困难重重。【原文：The European Union’s first inventory of methane emissions — one of the most potent drivers of global warming — is off to a rocky start, with some German firms not submitting their data.】

item.title: 日本最大核电站必须等待更长时间才能获得重启许可
item.description: 一位掌握着世界上最大核电站命运的日本地区长官说，自他上次访问以来，闲置核电站的安全措施有所改善。【原文：A Japanese regional governor who holds sway over the fate of the world’s largest nuclear power plant said security measures at the idled facility had improved since his last visit.】

item.title: 后期热浪过后，中国发电量创 20 个月来最大增幅
item.description: 随着热浪席卷中国南部地区，中国的发电量在 10 月份创下了自 2024 年 2 月以来的最大增幅。【原文：China’s power generation surged the most since February 2024 in October as a heat wave swamped the southern part of the country, with coal power plants picking up the slack amid slow growth in renewables.】
